extended_type_info.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // extended_type_info.hpp: interface for portable version of type_info
00011 
00012 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00013 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00014 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00015 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00016 
00017 //  See http://www.boost.org for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00018 
00019 // for now, extended type info is part of the serialization libraries
00020 // this could change in the future.
00021 #include <cstdarg>
00022 #include <cassert>
00023 #include <cstddef> // NULL
00024 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00025 #include <boost/noncopyable.hpp>
00026 #include <boost/serialization/config.hpp>
00027 
00028 #include <boost/config/abi_prefix.hpp> // must be the last header
00029 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00030 #  pragma warning(push)
00031 #  pragma warning(disable : 4251 4231 4660 4275)
00032 #endif
00033 
00034 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_MAX_KEY_SIZE 128
00035 
00036 namespace boost { 
00037 namespace serialization {
00038 class BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DECL(BOOST_PP_EMPTY()) extended_type_info :
00039     private boost::noncopyable
00040 {
00041 private: 
00042     // used to uniquely identify the type of class derived from this one
00043     // so that different derivations of this class can be simultaneously
00044     // included in implementation of sets and maps.
00045     const unsigned int m_type_info_key;
00046     virtual bool
00047     is_less_than(const extended_type_info & /*rhs*/) const {
00048         assert(false);
00049         return false;
00050     };
00051     virtual bool
00052     is_equal(const extended_type_info & /*rhs*/) const {
00053         assert(false);
00054         return false;
00055     };
00056     void key_unregister();
00057 protected:
00058     const char * m_key;
00059     // this class can't be used as is. It's just the 
00060     // common functionality for all type_info replacement
00061     // systems.  Hence, make these protected
00062     extended_type_info(const unsigned int type_info_key = 0);
00063     // account for bogus gcc warning
00064     #if defined(__GNUC__)
00065     virtual
00066     #endif
00067     ~extended_type_info();
00068 public:
00069     const char * get_key() const {
00070         return m_key;
00071     }
00072     void key_register(const char *key);
00073     bool operator<(const extended_type_info &rhs) const;
00074     bool operator==(const extended_type_info &rhs) const;
00075     bool operator!=(const extended_type_info &rhs) const {
00076         return !(operator==(rhs));
00077     }
00078     static const extended_type_info * find(const char *key);
00079     // for plugins
00080     virtual void * construct(unsigned int /*count*/ = 0, ...) const {
00081         assert(false); // must be implemented if used
00082         return NULL;
00083     };
00084     virtual void destroy(void const * const /*p*/) const {
00085         assert(false); // must be implemented if used
00086     }
00087 };
00088 
00089 } // namespace serialization 
00090 } // namespace boost
00091 
00092 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00093 #pragma warning(pop)
00094 #endif
00095 
00096 #include <boost/config/abi_suffix.hpp> // pops abi_suffix.hpp pragmas
00097 
00098 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXTENDED_TYPE_INFO_HPP
00099
